All our items are manufactured under strict quality control and meet national and international standards. usage.title: Applications
usage.text: Paving for airfield runways, urban roads, toll roads, connecting roads, and other paving works.

technical.p1: Polymer modified asphalt cements (PMA) have been used for many years to reduce the severity of distress and extend the service life of hot mix asphalt pavements and overlays.
technical.p2: XOLABIT offers the industry’s most advanced line of PMA, designed to maximize the beneficial effects of the binder on permanent deformation, fatigue, and low-temperature cracking under your environmental and traffic conditions.
technical.benefit1: Better resistance to permanent deformation (rutting and shoving)
technical.benefit2: Significantly improved tensile strength and elastic modulus
technical.benefit3: Improved fatigue resistance and temperature susceptibility
technical.benefit5: Increased service life and life-cycle cost savings
technical.benefit6: No special handling or storage conditions required
technical.benefit7: No special equipment required for transport or paving

usage.title: Applications
usage.text: Road pavements, tile adhesive, seal coating, resurfacing, as a filler material.

technical.p1: Asphalt emulsions are produced by grinding asphalt/bitumen into microscopic particles and dispersing them in water using chemical emulsifiers. The fine asphalt droplets remain uniformly suspended until the emulsion is applied.
technical.p2: The chemistry of the asphalt emulsion determines the stability of the system. When the emulsion is used in the field, the system eventually becomes unstable, causing the asphalt and water suspension to break. This leads to water evaporation, leaving behind asphalt residue that coats and binds aggregates during pavement application.
technical.p3: XOLABIT asphalt emulsions have a wide range of applications, from tile adhesive to underlayment for vehicles. The primary uses are tailored for roadways, including seal coating and recycling systems.

usage.title: Applications
usage.text: Suitable for minor repairs on sidewalks, access roads, potholes, storage areas, and work sites.

technical.p1: Cold mix asphalt refers to an asphalt mixture combined with unheated aggregates, mineral fillers, and asphalt emulsion. This mix can be used all day and is ideal for repairing various types of roadway surfaces.
technical.p2: This mixture requires no heating, is flexible, and can self-heal even under pressure and low temperatures.
technical.p3: Our Cold Asphalt Plant allows for custom designs to meet customer needs. Therefore, our cold asphalt is well-received by a wide range of users.

usage.title: Applications
usage.text: Moisture protection for walls, lining water tanks, preventing corrosion on undersides, metal structures, and vehicle roof assemblies; leak-proofing gutters and corrugated metal roofs; kitchens, bathrooms, concrete structures, boats, and fishing vessels.

technical.p1: XOLABIT manufactures and supplies a complete line of waterproof and moisture-barrier membranes.
technical.p2: Waterproof membranes form a monolithic layer resistant to moisture penetration while remaining flexible across a wide temperature range. They can be used in applications from bridges to roofing.
technical.p3: Moisture-barrier membranes are formulated with selected asphalt and petroleum cutback to meet waterproofing specifications. They serve as coatings or protective layers to enhance adhesion between substrates and coatings and prevent vapor migration through concrete or other structures.

usage.title: Applications
usage.text: Can be used on pipes, concrete, steel structures, wood, marine vessels, staircases, bridges, gutters, underground pipes, fences, gates, etc.

technical.p1: XOLABIT BITUMEN PAINT is used as a cold-applied protective coating that is effective, weather-resistant, and corrosion-resistant for concrete substrates. Suitable for metal surfaces, bridges, emergency staircases, gutters, fences, gates, and more.
technical.p2: XOLABIT BITUMEN PAINT can also be used as a primer for sheet and liquid membranes. It is suitable for marine environments and steel surfaces, as well as for the interiors of non-water tanks.

usage.title: Applications
usage.text: Can be used on walls, roofs, gutters, under pipes, and pools.

technical.p1: XOLABIT Membrane is a rubber-latex–reinforced, bitumen-based coating designed to provide flexibility and enhanced strength.
technical.p2: This membrane is used on retaining walls, roofs, ponds, underground pipes, drainage boxes, embankments, and other areas exposed to water.

usage.title: Applications
usage.text: Ideal for bridge joints, concrete pavement, waterproofing, building expansion joints, concrete joint sealants, and other flexible bitumen applications.

technical.p1: XOLABIT Asphaltic Plug is designed for expansion joints with low to medium movement capacity, suitable for use on highway bridges and other structures.
technical.p2: The maximum design joint movement for this product is ±25 mm horizontally and ±1.5 mm vertically.

article1.title: MSCR Testing: Ensuring Polymer Asphalt Quality for Heavy Traffic
article1.p1: Polymer-modified asphalt is asphalt blended with polymers to enhance its performance and resistance to damage under traffic loading. One method to evaluate high-temperature performance of polymer asphalt is the MSCR (Multiple Stress Creep Recovery) test, which measures its deformation behavior under cyclic loading.
article1.p2: In the MSCR test, different shear stress levels are applied for 1 second, followed by a 9-second recovery period. This cycle repeats 10 times at each stress level. Two key parameters are obtained: non-recoverable creep compliance (Jnr) and percent recovery (R). Jnr quantifies permanent deformation after recovery—lower Jnr means better rutting resistance. R indicates elastic recovery—higher R shows better viscoelasticity, absorbing traffic loads and mitigating fatigue cracking.
article1.p3: A major factor affecting high-temperature performance is traffic loading, expressed as ESAL (Equivalent Single Axle Load), representing cumulative axle load impacts over road life. High ESAL roads require polymer asphalt with low Jnr and high R for durability.
article1.p4: Thus, MSCR testing in relation to ESAL is vital for selecting the right polymer asphalt for heavy-traffic pavements. It guides mix design to match traffic and climate demands, ensuring long-lasting, high-performance road surfaces.

article2.title: PG-76 Polymer Asphalt Double Chip Seal Application for Mining Roads in Indonesia
article2.p1: Mining roads in Indonesia—such as those in Kalimantan and Sumatra—face extreme conditions: heavy traffic loads, high dust levels, standing water, and soil erosion. These factors cause pavement damage and high maintenance costs. A durable, long-lasting, and cost-effective preservation solution is therefore essential.
article2.p2: One potential solution is the use of hot double chip seal with PG-76 polymer asphalt. This technology involves sequential application of two layers of hot binder and crushed aggregate over the existing pavement surface. It creates a new wearing course resistant to cracking, raveling, and bleeding.
article2.p3: Hot double chip seal enhances skid resistance, provides waterproofing, and improves the pavement’s aesthetics. Additionally, this method dampens noise and reduces dust around mining sites.
article2.p4: The use of PG-76 polymer asphalt—modified with styrene-butadiene or styrene-butadiene-styrene (SBS)—adds significant value. This binder offers higher viscosity and elasticity than conventional asphalt, and is more resistant to extreme temperatures and aging. It delivers superior adhesion and cohesion, boosting chip seal durability under heavy traffic.
article2.p5: According to the Asphalt Emulsion Manufacturers Association (AEMA), PG-76 hot double chip seal can reduce life-cycle costs by up to 25% compared to conventional asphalt. It can also extend pavement service life by up to 7 years and cut maintenance frequency by 50%.
article2.p6: With all these advantages, PG-76 polymer asphalt hot double chip seal is the ideal choice for mining roads in Indonesia—offering long-term performance, cost savings, and environmental benefits.

article3.title: PG-76 Crumb Rubber Asphalt Solution for Double Chip Seal Applications on Mining Roads in Indonesia
article3.p1: Asphalt is a widely used pavement material due to its durability, skid resistance, and noise-reducing ability. However, extreme conditions such as high temperatures, heavy traffic loads, and mining environments demand stronger and more resilient asphalt innovations.
article3.p2: One such innovation is modifying asphalt with crumb rubber (CR) made from recycled used tires. Crumb rubber enhances asphalt performance against high temperatures, low-temperature cracking, fatigue, and aging. Additionally, it helps reduce tire waste and supports environmental sustainability.
article3.p3: In practice, CR can be blended into asphalt using the wet process method. This technique allows CR to react directly with the asphalt, producing a homogeneous mixture with high adhesion and improved elasticity.
article3.image1_alt: PG-76 crumb rubber asphalt application in the field
article3.p4: An advanced form of crumb rubber is PG-76 CR, which is specifically modified to increase resistance to permanent deformation, cracking, and moisture. PG-76 offers higher viscosity and structural strength compared to standard CR, making it ideal for extreme mining conditions.
article3.p5: The implementation of PG-76 CR is particularly well suited for the double chip seal method, which involves applying two successive layers of asphalt and aggregate over an existing pavement. This approach strengthens the wearing course, enhances resistance to water and weathering, and significantly extends service life.
article3.image2_alt: Double chip seal application with crumb rubber
article3.p6: Double chip seal with PG-76 CR offers several benefits: resilience to extreme weather, strong interlayer bonding, and significant reductions in noise and dust. For mining roads in Indonesia—where temperature fluctuations, heavy-machinery traffic, and challenging subgrade conditions are common—this technology provides a long-term, efficient, and eco-friendly solution.
article3.p7: By using crumb rubber–modified PG-76 asphalt and the double chip seal method, companies can reduce maintenance costs, extend pavement life, and support productive tire-waste management. It represents a strategic step toward sustainable and modern mining infrastructure.

article4.title: Key Cost Drivers in Asphalt and Bitumen Preservation
article4.p1: Pavement preservation plays a vital role in developing and maintaining modern infrastructure, including safe and efficient transport networks across Indonesia. The two most common materials used in preservation are asphalt and bitumen. Understanding the complex factors that influence project costs is essential for effective budget management.
article4.p2: Materials are the primary component of overall costs. Market price fluctuations for asphalt and bitumen, as well as varying quality grades, affect durability and service life. Choosing the right material is critical to long-term cost efficiency.
article4.p3: Execution processes such as surface preparation, material application, and compaction require skilled labor. Beyond wages, team efficiency and expertise impact final quality and project duration, directly affecting total costs.
article4.p4: Heavy machinery such as pavers, sprayers, and rollers significantly contribute to costs. Operational expenses like fuel, maintenance, and investment in advanced technology must be factored in. While modern equipment improves precision and efficiency, it often comes with a higher upfront price.
article4.p5: Road design factors, traffic volume, and geographic conditions influence material quantities, application methods, and equipment selection. Roads with sharp curves or challenging topography demand specialized approaches, raising complexity and costs.
article4.p6: Cost planning must extend beyond initial construction. Long‐term maintenance, inspections, and minor repairs should be considered. Using high‐quality materials up front can reduce the frequency of major overhauls later.
article4.p7: Compliance with local regulations, safety standards, and environmental permits can impact project costs and timelines. Non‐compliance may lead to fines or delays, making early permit management crucial.
article4.p8: Emerging preservation trends include eco‐friendly materials and data‐driven predictive maintenance. Adopting these technologies can lower long‐term expenses and boost project sustainability.
article4.p9: Xolabit Bitumen Indonesia leads the way in delivering efficient, innovative pavement preservation solutions. By taking a holistic approach to materials, workforce, and regulations, Xolabit sets a new benchmark for cost efficiency and service quality.
article4.p10: Through continuous innovation and sustainable practices, Xolabit Bitumen Indonesia invites all stakeholders to build resilient, safe, and efficient road infrastructure for Indonesia’s future.

article6.title: Xolabit Liquid Bituminous Waterproofing
article6.p1: Xolabit Liquid Bituminous Waterproofing is a water-resistant coating method based on SS-1h anionic bitumen emulsion. It’s easy to apply, quickly forms a waterproof membrane, and is suitable for a variety of surfaces.
article6.p2: SS-1h (Slow Setting-1 Hard) is a bitumen emulsion with low viscosity and slow setting. In this anionic emulsion, negatively charged bitumen particles are dispersed in water with an emulsifier. As the water evaporates, the particles coalesce into a waterproof layer.
article6.p3: Xolabit Liquid Waterproofing can be applied by spray, brush, or roller to surfaces such as roofs, basement walls, bridges, and foundations. Curing occurs naturally depending on weather and temperature.
features: Easy application without heating or special equipment
Suitable for mineral substrates like concrete, brick, and plaster
Resistant to extreme weather and mechanical damage
Environmentally friendly with low VOC and solvent-free
article6.p4: This technology has been used in infrastructure projects such as highways, bridges, mines, tanks, and green roofs. Its practical application process is ideal for hard-to-reach areas.
